鴠鴠鴠

鴠字的基本解释

鴠
dàn
〔渴（
h?）鴠〕寒号鸟。亦作“鹖鴠”。

鴠字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dàn］
［《廣韻》得按切，去翰，端。］
(1)鸟名。参见“鴠鳥”。
(2)用同“蛋”。

鴠字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【鳥字部】　鴠； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1486第12
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】得案切【正韻】得爛切，?音旦。䳚旦，鳥也。【增韻】䳚旦，求旦之鳥，似雞，晝夜常鳴。【揚子·方言】周魏齊宋之閒謂之獨春，自關而東謂之城旦，秦隴之內謂之鶡鴠。【禮·月令】仲冬，鶡旦不鳴。又【集韻】黨旱切，音亶。義同。○按鶡鴠，因求旦之聲得名，本作盍旦。《禮坊記》引《詩》相彼盍旦，尙猶患之。或作曷旦。《月令》作鶡旦，《廣志》作侃旦，《方言》作鶡鴠，別作鳱鴠、䳚鴠、渴旦。

鴠字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
鴠字的起名意思

暂无。

Ying
Basic explanation of words
Ying
dàn
〔thirsty(
h?) Bing] cold bird. Also known as "hehe".
Ying
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dàn］
["Guang Yun" must be cut, go to Han, end. ]
(1) The name of the bird. See "Bing Bird".
(2) Use the same "egg".
Ying
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Collection] [Bird Character Department] 　鴠; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 1486 Page 12
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] The case is cut [Zheng Yun] is so bad,? Yin Dan. The bird is also the bird. 【Enhanced rhyme】Half-dan, the bird of seeking-dan, resembles a chicken, humming often day and night. [Yangtze Dialect] Zhou, Wei, Qi, and Song Dynasty are called Duchun, from Guan to the east, they are called Chengdan, and within Qinlong, they are called Hewei. 【Rite·Monthly Order】In midwinter, there will be no sound at all. Also 【Jiyun】The party is dry, and the sound is endless. The same meaning. ○According to Hexie, it was named after the name of Qiudan, and it was originally written as Qidan. "Book of Rites" quotes "The Poetry" to compare with Bei Jiandan, which is still in trouble. Or as a jundan. "Yue Ling" is used for Hedan, "Guangzhi" is used for Kandan, and "Dialect" is used for Heying. Don't be used for Xiaoying, Yiying, and Kedan.
Ying
